channel.title: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth
channel.description: hi im trying to figure out why when i log out and in on a client into and out of the game there is a time of seconds where there is 2 players showing online in the SERVER. thanks in advance.

item.title: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

ok, now that has been learned lol can we please move on to implementing the getpass into the login server … how do we do it?

Read full topic
item.source: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth

item.title: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“The Djinn, post:27, topic:518451”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=636717.msg4293792#msg4293792 date=1367850162]

[quote author=The Djinn link=topic=636717.msg4293708#msg4293708 date=1367820380]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=636717.msg4293197#msg4293197 date=1367716132]

Whats the problem? Why cant you get moparclassic set up? I can help if you post specific problems in this thread

I have set it up to use SerializedStorageMedium and PersistenceAuth, when i try to log in it says invalid username or password.

Have you tried using DummyAuth too? It will work with that.

ok i know it works, but it will save the username and not the password. example- test with password 1234 can be logged into with test and any password at all to log in.
Im trying to figure out how to make it check the database for the password aswell as username to match.
[/quote]DummyAuth is not for checking passwords… You need to use PersistenceAuth and make the getPass method work; I’ll probably get around to it sometime this week.

ok thanks i guess i will just wait it out… no big deal, id just like to get a server online sometime

Can’t you just do a query to get the players password for login?

SELECT from Passwords WHERE Username = MattyMatt

Make a method to return the password, ie getPassword()

if (MD5(typedInPassword).equals(player.getPassword())) { System.out.println("Password: "+typedInPassword+""); }
Then like,

yeah. Shouldn’t be to hard
[/quote]facepalm

The serialized storage medium doesn’t use SQL, dumbass.

I haven’t looked at the source, I was going off the top of my head. It seemed like he was asking how to pull the password from the database and just gave an example.
[/quote]No, it doesn’t seem like that at all, especially when he said he was using the SerializedStorageMedium…

Furthermore, your code shows a complete lack of competence… Why would an instance of player have a getPassword method that queries a database, when there is a system for storage mediums already implemented? Also, why would you be displaying someone’s password?

I didn’t compare that code to Moparclassic, I don’t even have the Moparclassic source on my computer anymore. I was giving an example. I displayed it, because I can.[/quote]You didn’t need to look at MoparClassic to recognize what a serialized storage medium is or what it is used for… Especially in this context.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth

item.title: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:25, topic:518451”][quote author=The Djinn link=topic=636717.msg4293708#msg4293708 date=1367820380]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=636717.msg4293197#msg4293197 date=1367716132]

[quote author=The Djinn link=topic=636717.msg4293195#msg4293195 date=1367715599]

Whats the problem? Why cant you get moparclassic set up? I can help if you post specific problems in this thread

I have set it up to use SerializedStorageMedium and PersistenceAuth, when i try to log in it says invalid username or password.

Have you tried using DummyAuth too? It will work with that.

ok i know it works, but it will save the username and not the password. example- test with password 1234 can be logged into with test and any password at all to log in.
Im trying to figure out how to make it check the database for the password aswell as username to match.
[/quote]DummyAuth is not for checking passwords… You need to use PersistenceAuth and make the getPass method work; I’ll probably get around to it sometime this week.

ok thanks i guess i will just wait it out… no big deal, id just like to get a server online sometime

Can’t you just do a query to get the players password for login?

SELECT from Passwords WHERE Username = MattyMatt

Make a method to return the password, ie getPassword()

if (MD5(typedInPassword).equals(player.getPassword())) { System.out.println("Password: "+typedInPassword+""); }
Then like,

yeah. Shouldn’t be to hard
[/quote]facepalm

The serialized storage medium doesn’t use SQL, dumbass.

I haven’t looked at the source, I was going off the top of my head. It seemed like he was asking how to pull the password from the database and just gave an example.
[/quote]No, it doesn’t seem like that at all, especially when he said he was using the SerializedStorageMedium…

Furthermore, your code shows a complete lack of competence… Why would an instance of player have a getPassword method that queries a database, when there is a system for storage mediums already implemented? Also, why would you be displaying someone’s password?[/quote]

I didn’t compare that code to Moparclassic, I don’t even have the Moparclassic source on my computer anymore. I was giving an example. I displayed it, because I can.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“The Djinn, post:24, topic:518451”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=636717.msg4293197#msg4293197 date=1367716132]

[quote author=The Djinn link=topic=636717.msg4293195#msg4293195 date=1367715599]

Whats the problem? Why cant you get moparclassic set up? I can help if you post specific problems in this thread

I have set it up to use SerializedStorageMedium and PersistenceAuth, when i try to log in it says invalid username or password.

Have you tried using DummyAuth too? It will work with that.

ok i know it works, but it will save the username and not the password. example- test with password 1234 can be logged into with test and any password at all to log in.
Im trying to figure out how to make it check the database for the password aswell as username to match.
[/quote]DummyAuth is not for checking passwords… You need to use PersistenceAuth and make the getPass method work; I’ll probably get around to it sometime this week.

ok thanks i guess i will just wait it out… no big deal, id just like to get a server online sometime

Can’t you just do a query to get the players password for login?

SELECT from Passwords WHERE Username = MattyMatt

Make a method to return the password, ie getPassword()

if (MD5(typedInPassword).equals(player.getPassword())) { System.out.println("Password: "+typedInPassword+""); }
Then like,

yeah. Shouldn’t be to hard
[/quote]facepalm

The serialized storage medium doesn’t use SQL, dumbass.

I haven’t looked at the source, I was going off the top of my head. It seemed like he was asking how to pull the password from the database and just gave an example.[/quote]No, it doesn’t seem like that at all, especially when he said he was using the SerializedStorageMedium…

Furthermore, your code shows a complete lack of competence… Why would an instance of player have a getPassword method that queries a database, when there is a system for storage mediums already implemented? Also, why would you be displaying someone’s password?

Read full topic

Im trying to figure out how to make it check the database for the password aswell as username to match.

ok thanks i guess i will just wait it out… no big deal, id just like to get a server online sometime

Can’t you just do a query to get the players password for login?

SELECT from Passwords WHERE Username = MattyMatt

Make a method to return the password, ie getPassword()

if (MD5(typedInPassword).equals(player.getPassword())) { System.out.println("Password: "+typedInPassword+""); }
Then like,

yeah. Shouldn’t be to hard
[/quote]facepalm

The serialized storage medium doesn’t use SQL, dumbass.[/quote]

I haven’t looked at the source, I was going off the top of my head. It seemed like he was asking how to pull the password from the database and just gave an example.

item.title: Getting Moparclassic to work with SSMedium and PersistenceAuth
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

i don;t understand why people have to act cruel against others. Thanks for all responses and help trying to help. even from somone saying a wrong response others that read it can learn something from it, so i dont see the need to bash people. im hoping that i can get this to work for the sake of getting a server online…

its a text based save, but serialized with just a login server that needs the getpass method to work, so how do we get it done? thanks

Read full topic

item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

tigerclan:

Dude to be honest you’ve been posting these requests for help for weeks on end(more than a month) and you still haven’t managed to get a server online. I’m not trying to be a dick, I’m just saying… maybe try something easier than a private server for now… sorry

i dont want to do anything else… ive had a few servers up for years. now if someone can be positive and help me id appreciate it as i like runescape classic only

thanks cause that really helps alot. That’s all you guys say every time i ask someone to help me with this problem because you do not know what it is --that is the problem

EDIT: at the least can you just tell me where to start if you know at least that… i will try to figure it out
[/quote]Nobody is going to waste their time with EasyRSC… It’s just bad and has tons of bugs; nobody is even interested in working on it either.[/quote]
well how about helping me to get MOparclassic online and working right…

I want to use serializeStorageMedium and
what auth do i use to make sure when i try to log in an account it verify’s the username and pass??? i have used persistence auth without any luck.
